column4: ok this is wierd, im isntalling ubuntu and when i get to the partitioning part it jsut repepatedly says 'Killed' and jsut keeps on repeating...
from the forums it seems to be a problem on computers with 64mb rasm...which is what this box has :(

that is so small I don't think you will get much use out of that install, that is a very low spec machine I would suggest that you use DSL (damn small linux) or install server first and see if you can get xubuntu-desktop working on it - its really low on resources
its a good system, jsut low on ram. it wont run DSL (monitor rejects the resolution it uses) but its failing on partitioning, not the actual OS
for dsl start the boot with vga=771
partition wise what do you want to do with it
its empty now, 9.6GB ext3 and 512MB of swap
so try to do a server install from the off
as the machine boots, it pauses, type server and work away from there
now its giving a segmentation fault on teh drive at partition stage
while the machine your on is way below spec - I would now suspect the media more than anything
thanks, i think iv found the problem, it was burned at 16x the first time insteadc of 4x, il see how it goes after reburning
nope, when i do normal install it jsut repeats "killed" ans when i  do server it says "segmentation fault" i guess therses jsut not enough ram, it cant partition the drive
